resources.string: Roaming is currently turned off. You need to turn on data roaming to use Navigation.
You are roaming. Additional charges may apply. Do you want to continue?
Please do not operate the application or phone while driving and remember that the road traffic regulations have priority over the navigation instructions.
You need to enter a phone number
You need to enter a message
You don't have a valid location yet. Make sure your phone is in an open space so it can receive the GPS signal.
The GPS signal is not strong enough. Make sure the device is placed in an open space.
You need to either enter a name or choose a category
You need to turn on the GPS settings to use Vodafone Navigation.
Are you sure you want to cancel the route?
You need to enter a SIM card and turn on your internet connection to use Vodafone Navigation.
Make sure your internet connection settings are turned on. For further help, contact Vodafone Customer Services or visit www.vodafone.com/maps.

You can find your destination by making a search, using one of your saved places or by selecting a place on the map. Your position is automatically indicated by an icon.

You can pan, zoom in/out or tap the area on the map you want to navigate to. Zoom in and out of the map by pressing + and -. 

By tapping the screen you place a red pin on the map. Tap the red pin and select if you want to navigate to the selected position on the map, or to save the position as a favourite place. 

You can access the search view by clicking the Menu key and select "Search", or by tapping the "Tap to find destination" field at the bottom of the screen. 

You can plan a route by either clicking the Menu key and select "Navigate", by selecting a saved place or by tapping the map and selecting "Navigate to". 

If you are not receiving a GPS signal, make sure your phone is in an open space with a clear line of sight to the sky.

Once you are driving, the Navigation view guides you turn-by-turn by voice instructions and displays your route on the map, either in 3D or in 2D. Your route is displayed as a coloured line on the map, with your position indicated by an icon. \n\nThe larger icon at the top of the screen shows the next event or turn in your route. Here you can also see the next street name. The current street name is displayed at the bottom of the screen.

You can add a widget to the homescreen which gives you instant text information on where you are. Press and hold on an empty space on the homescreen. Browse to the Android widget section and select \"Navigation\". \n\nClick on the refresh icon in the widget's top right corner to get your current position. Click on the widget to access the Navigation application. When a route is active, click on the square in the top right corner to cancel the route or on the icon to return to navigation view.
Add My Places folder to homescreen

You can add an Android live folder to the homescreen which gives you instant access to your saved favourite places. Press and hold on an empty space on the homescreen. Select \"Folder\" > \"Live folder\" > \"My places\". \n\nClick on the \"My places\" folder to have instant access to all your saved places. Select one in order to navigate to it.

You can find addresses, companies, people*, phone numbers* and places by making a search. To make a search you either tap the "Tap to find destination" field at the start screen or press the Menu key, select "Search" and enter what you are looking for. If you want to find something/someone in the nearby area (within %s) check the "Search around me" checkbox. 

You can also make a search by selecting a category, i.e. airport, ATM, hotel or restaurant. 

Or, you can search by entering what you are looking for and selecting a category.

To set another place or area to search in, uncheck the "Search around me" checkbox. 

Perform the search by clicking the magnifying icon to the right.

* Not available in all countries and regions.

Your search results will be displayed on the map, as well as in a scrollable list. They are listed by relevance if you have done a defined search, and by distance if you have searched around you. 

You will see the map centred on your top search hits. If you tap a placemark in the list, the map will move to and centre on that placemark.

You can resize the list by pressing the "handle" at the upper right corner of the list.

Once you have found what you are looking for, tap the result, in the list or on the map, and select if you want to navigate to it, add it to \"My places\" (your favourite places) or view the place's details.

Search for a favourite location. Tap the result you were looking for and it becomes highlighted. Tap once again to access \"Save place\". Add this place, edit the details and save it. You can also save a place directly in the map, by tapping the pin and pressing \"Save place\".
Your saved favourite places can be either saved search results or locations saved from the map. You can use your saved places to navigate to it, or show it on map.

In the Map view certain places (eg petrol stations and train stations) are displayed as icons. 

Your position is indicated by an icon when you are receiving GPS signal. If you do not have a GPS signal, a circle in the map will indicate your approximate position.

You can zoom in and out of the map by pressing + and -.

In Settings you can personalise the application according to your own preferences.

General settings contain settings for the application, for example which distance unit you want to use.

Route settings contain settings that for example allow you to select if you want to optimise your route calculation to the fastest or shortest route available.
Unable to calculate route to your destination. Choose a different destination.
Unable to calculate route from your current position.
Welcome to Vodafone Navigation which will let you find locations and navigate to a destination.
Search results will be near to your current position.
Search results will be within the city or country you entered.

Make sure your connection settings are correct. For further help, contact Vodafone Customer Services or visit www.vodafone.com/maps
Your saved places are being synchronised.
We're sorry, an error has occurred. Please try again.
To use Vodafone Navigation you need to turn off the Wi-Fi connection and instead enable the mobile data connection.
Rerouting failed. \n\nDo you want to retry?
A new version of this application is available for download.
